title: Mystery Cheltenham used for L.L. Bean Logo logo
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023111802im_/http:/typophile.com/files/logo_4753.gif)

Hi All,

I'm almost certain this is a cheltenham, but can't find the right one. Any suggestions? The closest I found was Cheltenham EF, but its not quite right.

Thanks,

Cory
author: user_1969

comments.content: It doesn’t match any digitisation of [Cheltenham](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023111802/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=Cheltenham+OT) I could find nor does it the lesser known [Gloucester](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023111802/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/monotype/gloucester_std_vp/). I think this must be either pre-digital or a clone.
LL Bean has been printing its catalogs in Cheltenham for almost 100 years, so it's part of the brand identity. For the logo, they probably had a designer tweak it a little.
Looking at a LL Bean pdf you see Bitstream Cheltenham and another set called BeanCheltBook, BeanBookItalic and BeanBold. Those must be the tweaked ones.

Isn't it just **ITC** Cheltenham (maybe with slight modifications)? Similarities are obvious, and proportions match... (taking into account the fact the sample is quite small, so I cannot compare it better)

@PublishingMojo

Where did you find this PDF? Are these fonts available for purchase anywhere?

Thanks,

Cory
